revised_title: Exploring the Nucleus Structure of Atoms
tldr: Sir Ernest Rutherford discusses the structure of atoms and introduces the concept of a nucleus, a central part of the atom containing most of its mass and positive charge. He explains how the scattering of alpha particles through large angles can provide valuable information about the forces within the atom and the nature of its nucleus. Rutherford's experiments and theories laid the foundation for modern atomic theory and nuclear physics.
